bibl.title: For Particular Reasons – Studies in Honour of Jerker Blomqvist
bibl.note: Edition of P. Cornell Inv. 69 recto (= Pack2 2317), already known from a photograph reproduced by: Otto NEUGEBAUER, The Exact Sciences in Antiquity. Second edition (Copenhagen, 1957) pl. 12. Thesis on geometry (with two drawings) in the Heronian tradition. Second century AD. The back was re-used for an account of artabas of wheat in what seems to be a third-century cursive hand (too fragmentary for publication). - Text. - Translation. - General remarks on the mathematical problems that seem to be solved in this papyrus. - Special remarks on details. - Divisors and other properties of the numbers identified in P. Cornell Inv. 69.
bibl.seg: BÜLOW-JACOBSEN Adam and Christian Marinus TAISBAK, P. Cornell inv. 69. Fragment of a Handbook in Geometry.

Anders PILTZ, Johanna AKUJÄRVI, Vassilios SABATAKAKIS, Karin BLOMQVIST, Georg WALSER and Lars NORDGREN (Edd.), For Particular Reasons. Studies in Honour of Jerker Blomqvist (Lund, 2003) pp. 54-70, 1 pl.

Edition of P. Cornell Inv. 69 recto (= Pack2 2317), already known from a photograph reproduced by: Otto NEUGEBAUER, The Exact Sciences in Antiquity. Second edition (Copenhagen, 1957) pl. 12. Thesis on geometry (with two drawings) in the Heronian tradition. Second century AD. The back was re-used for an account of artabas of wheat in what seems to be a third-century cursive hand (too fragmentary for publication). - Text. - Translation. - General remarks on the mathematical problems that seem to be solved in this papyrus. - Special remarks on details. - Divisors and other properties of the numbers identified in P. Cornell Inv. 69.
